Exaggerate: The claim may be exaggerating the number of people who died of Covid-19 in comparison to the number of overdose deaths.
Understate: The claim may be understating the number of overdose deaths in order to emphasize the impact of Covid-19.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks specific data or sources to support the comparison between Covid-19 deaths and overdose deaths.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim does not consider alternative explanations or factors that could contribute to the difference in death tolls.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that more people died of Covid-19 in two months than the total overdose deaths in the previous year or the year before.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the comparison between Covid-19 deaths and overdose deaths is a relevant or meaningful comparison.
